testproblem.name: Standing free surface wave in channel using P1DG-P2.

variables.variable: import os files = os.listdir("./") solvers_converged = not "matrixdump" in files and not "matrixdump.info" in files

import fluidity_tools det=fluidity_tools.stat_parser('standing_wave.detectors') fsl=det['water']['FreeSurface']['LeftTop'] t=det['ElapsedTime']['value'] fs_left={} fs_left['min']=fsl.min() fs_left['min_time']=t[fsl.argmin()] fs_left['end_value']=fsl[-1]

import fluidity_tools det=fluidity_tools.stat_parser('standing_wave.detectors') fsr=det['water']['FreeSurface']['RightTop'] t=det['ElapsedTime']['value'] fs_right={} fs_right['max']=fsr.max() fs_right['max_time']=t[fsr.argmax()] fs_right['end_value']=fsr[-1]

import vtktools vtu_init_run=vtktools.vtu('standing_wave_2.pvtu') vtu_checkp=vtktools.vtu('standing_wave_checkpoint_1.pvtu') diff=vtktools.VtuDiff(vtu_init_run, vtu_checkp) checkpoint_differences=dict([(name,abs(diff.GetField(name)).max()) for name in diff.GetFieldNames()])The checkpoint is run from half-way the initial run to the end. The outcome of the checkpoint run at the end should then be the same as the initial run at the end.

pass_tests.test: assert len(checkpoint_differences.values())==7 assert max(checkpoint_differences.values())<1e-9For me it comes out as 0 exactly, but let's allow for some round off.
